items.title: Browser's default tab-support doesn't work (BZ#2)
items.body:
_Steve Brendtro (Steven.L.Brendtro) wrote:_

Once the qooxdoo javascript is added to a webpage, the user is unable to tab between HTML form elements.  To reproduce this error simply add a form to a webpage that has qooxdoo.js on it, then try to tab between the form input boxes.

The URL on this ticket is another example of this behavior.

This may be functioning as designed, however I would like to know how to shut it off.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Add a Scrollbar widget (BZ#5)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should support a own scrollbar widget which supports qooxdoo methods for styling.

items.title: Add a Splitpane widget (BZ#6)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should support a splitpane widget which allows user-interactive resizing of layout-parts.

_assigned to Volker Pauli (vpauli)_

items.title: Add a Slider widget (BZ#7)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should support a slider widget to allow users to easily select numeric values.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Add a Progressbar widget (BZ#8)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

To allow users to get informations of the progress of some action, qooxdoo should support progressbars.

_assigned to Adrian Olaru (adrian.olaru)_

items.title: Add a Splashscreen widget (BZ#9)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should support Slashscreens to indicate application loading. There should be an easy method to customize the loading screen of qooxdoo, if added sometimes.

items.title: Add a Hidden-Field widget (BZ#10)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should also support hidden fields i.e. <input type="hidden"/> to allow to use qooxdoo to fill an underlaying form with data fields.

items.title: Reimplement properties (BZ#16)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_
- Use creation on demand for setter/getter types
- Using "new Function" to create these functions
- Remove layout centric parts from property implementation
- Real property default values: Call modifier for default values, too
- Dramatic optimization for performance
- Support toggling features for boolean values
- Support multiple values with priority (discuss, to support recursive enabling, appearance etc.)

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Improve data and parameter handling for transport API (BZ#17)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Parameters are currently always added to the query string and will be used for a GET-like request, even if the user want POST requests.

IframeTransport should create hidden fields instead of using the query string to transfer parameters.

Transport API should also support file uploads.

items.title: Reimplement layout engine (BZ#20)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

The layout engine is sometimes problematic. One case is for widgets which depends on their own computed dimensions. They currently compute the dimensions while rendering and interrupting the layouter this way. This is currently true for QxListView and the new table implementation.

The requirements for the new engine:
- Allow access to computed values at any time.
- Remove spacing and margins from inner width/height of each ''Parent'' to calculate percents. (Mail: Stanislav Ievlev, 08.02.2006, 13:18 Uhr)
- Optimize unit detection and unit handling and storage for dimension and location properties. Try to remove all these boolean flags.
- Try to only have one queue for layouts and jobs
- Omit caching on setting of the value.
- Try to reduce caching stuff (sometimes the cache is probably slower than the (re-)calculation)
- Discuss if it is useful to also cache hasPercentX, hasAutoX, ...
- Reimplement cached properties so that the invaliation will not set the old value to null, but set a isInvalid flag which will define that the next get must re-evaluate the value first.
- Add depth property to widgets. Sort job queue according to depth before flush.
- Add overflow fallback handling to layouts (e.g. show a menu at the end when the toolbar is to small)
- Support overflow 'auto' with 'auto' width or(/and?) height
- Support splitted overflow properties "overflow-x/y" in gecko-1.8 (split overflow properties for this?)

Nice to have:
- Think about additionally supporting dimensions like '100%-10' as in RelativeLayers
- Move all layout depending properties from widgets to the used layout implementation like in Qt or SWT.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: ListView is wrong layouted (BZ#21)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

ListView is problematic inside complex layout parents like DockLayout or inside a BoxLayout if the height is defined as a flex (1*) value.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Speed-up toggling (tree, tabView) without re-layouting of children (BZ#22)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

The performance of re-open a tree folder isn't optimal and should be improved.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Extract client support stuff to separate class (BZ#23)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

It would be nice to separate the main logic of the layout system to something like QxClientSupport, which contains informations such a browser supports stretching (left<->right, top<->bottom, min- and max-sizes, box-sizing, ...)

items.title: Map scrollLeft and scrollTop from iframe node (BZ#24)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

For easier access and user handling, scrollLeft and scrollTop getters/setter of Iframe should be mapped to the iframe node.

items.title: Add support for tooltiptext (BZ#26)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Add a new property tooltiptext (could be HTML or text) which will be used, if configured, for a shared tooltip between all widgets. This would reduce the amount of tooltips needed to create.

Maybe this is also possible for icons inside tooltips? Or other complex things.

_assigned to Fabian Jakobs (@fjakobs)_

items.title: Make contextmenu usage easier (BZ#27)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Optimize integration and usage of contextmenus would be great. There is already a contextmenu property but it isn't used currently.

items.title: Rounded corners support (BZ#28)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should support rounded corners. The built-ins are already nice, but not rounded. To enhance visual presentation of tooltips and maybe other stuff, rounded corners would be nice.

_assigned to Fabian Jakobs (@fjakobs)_

items.title: SelectionManager should support automatic function binding (BZ#29)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Generally the most widgets which use the selection manager route some self-registered events to this manager. Maybe this could be automated using some "function binding".

items.title: Support image clipping/concatenation (BZ#31)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Support for multiple images in one image source (clipping) (see ActiveWidgets)

This would allow faster switching for hover, active etc. effects on typical image based widgets.

_assigned to Thomas Herchenroeder (@thron7)_

items.title: Checkbox and Radiobutton should be image based (BZ#32)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

To allow further theming through widget themes, RadioButton and CheckBox should use image instead of form elements for visual representation of the input field.

items.title: Support focus groups (BZ#33)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

In Windows XP for example all members of a radio group a focus able as a group and not separated. It would be nice if qooxdoo could support something comparable.

This would reduce the number of focus able widgets. We should find a way how to change this behaviour somewhere in the widget stuff. Maybe not that easy, because these radio-managers are no real widgets.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Support image features for background images, too. (BZ#34)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Some features like image bindings to themes etc. are not available for background images. This should be enhanced.

items.title: Support for forced image refreshes (BZ#35)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo should comes with a built-in support for requested image refreshes. This could maybe implemented using random query strings which will be automatically added to the url. The question is in which part of qooxdoo this should be implemented.

items.title: Convert mouse and keyevents to singletons (BZ#36)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

To improve performance, events like MouseEvent and KeyEvent which could also occour once at time should be converted to singletons to reduce the number of created objects.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Optimize caching inside ColorObject (BZ#37)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

ColorObject has a seperate caching algorithm inside the constructor, which is a bit inefficient as it returns from the constructor call (like the old singletons did).

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Optimize caching of Border- and FontObject (BZ#38)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

BorderObject and FontObject caching is implemented inside the _Cache methods which is the better way. But this makes direct creation of BorderObject or FontObject inefficient as then each identical border or font creates its own object._

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Rethought global dispose solution (BZ#39)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Experiment with Object disposing (array slicing, etc.)

Array slicing to remove data also reduces memory usage of Internet Explorer. When disposing objects and not leaving the page the IE will not collect garbage, so that even disposed objects are not freed from memory. For a long-time running application this would mean an increase of memory over the runtime. This is not directly a memory leak, as the browser will freed memory after leaving the page completely.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Support for more named/themed colors should be added (BZ#41)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

qooxdoo comes already with themed colors like "buttontext" or "threedface". It would be nice to add more of these, or to remove unused ones to add support for coloring tabs and other currently missing parts.

items.title: Fixing Appearance Issues with dynamic changes of theme and state (BZ#42)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Appearance (problems in run-time switching, most visible in dimension changes, padding/margin). Related to current property system that does not account for user-supplied values, i.e. does not support priorities.

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_

items.title: Add support for recursive enabling/disabling of widgets (BZ#43)
items.body:
_Sebastian Werner (@swernerx) wrote:_

Recursive Enabling/Disabling of Widgets (Related to property rework, property inheritance (maybe we could inform us how to implement inheritance generally)) (user defined vs. appearance defined vs. inheritance defined)

_assigned to Sebastian Werner (@swernerx)_
